name: Immunization for canine leptospirosis
details: A vaccine that protects dogs against leptospirosis, a bacterial infection that can affect the liver and kidneys. Leptospirosis is zoonotic, meaning it can also be transmitted to humans, making vaccination an essential preventative measure for pets and their owners.

name: Immunization for feline leukemia
details: A vaccine designed to protect cats from feline leukemia virus (FeLV), which can suppress the immune system and lead to severe illnesses. This immunization is especially important for outdoor or social cats that may come into contact with infected animals.

name: Immunization for bordetella
description: Administration of vaccine product containing Bordetella bronchisepticum antigen
details: A vaccine to protect against Bordetella bronchiseptica, a common bacterial cause of kennel cough in dogs. This immunization is particularly recommended for dogs that are frequently in contact with other pets in environments like boarding facilities or dog parks.

name: Administration of Lyme disease vaccine
description: Administration of vaccine product containing only Borrelia burgdorferi antigen
details: A vaccine designed to protect against Borrelia burgdorferi, the bacterium responsible for Lyme disease. This immunization is crucial for dogs that may be exposed to ticks in endemic areas, helping to prevent the onset of this potentially serious illness.
